result.execSummary:
The defendant Traves B Weed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any alcohol until he has completed AODA assessment and receives written permission by his Agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Traves B Weed

records.addlTxt:
DA Snider present.
Def. present.
Atty. Tom Johnson present.
DA Snider moves to amend Ct. #1 to failure to comply with 72 hours no contact provision - 968.075(5)(a)1 - misd.
Amended Ct. #1 - NC plea
Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of amended Ct. #1.
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
Recommendations by counsel.
The Court imposes and stays 45 days co jail w/Huber privileges.
Probation - 1 year
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action + DOMAB surcharge.
2.  pay supervision fees.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments or counseling deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow any treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. to not possess any alcohol until he has completed AODA and receives written permission by his Agent.
Def. to meet w/P&P today.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 10:45 am.
